meanings.definition: Not plentiful or abundant; in short supply.
meanings.sent1: Water was the scarcest resource in the desert.
meanings.sent2: During the drought, fresh fruits and vegetables were the scarcest items at the market.
meanings.sent3: In the land of candy, vegetables were the scarcest treats.
meanings.sent4: Her scarcest smile was reserved for special occasions.
meanings.sent5: The scarcest gem in the treasure chest was a rare diamond.

meanings.definition: Occurring or found in small numbers; rare.
meanings.sent1: The scarcest bird in the forest was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent2: Finding a four-leaf clover is one of the scarcest occurrences in nature.
meanings.sent3: In a world of talkative parrots, a silent bird was the scarcest find.
meanings.sent4: Her scarcest talent was her ability to mimic any accent perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The scarcest flower in the garden bloomed only once a year.
